intro: Conostylis melanopogon var. major, commonly known as the dark-horned conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This variant is characterized by its dark purple or blackish spikelets, which are often clustered at the ends of its slender stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal or inland regions of southern Australia.
